abstract: Fatal injury sustained by high school football player Ridge Barden after a seemingly ordinary collision is an unwelcome reminder that even the best-known measures for preventing brain injuries in football sometimes fall short; Barden's death and others like it in college and youth football has spurred the Senate Commerce Committee to hold a hearing to discuss concussions in sports and the controversial marketing of 'anticoncussion' equipment.
snippet: Despite efforts to improve safety, brains — especially those of teens — remain vulnerable, and routine collisions can kill.
lead_paragraph: Despite efforts to improve safety, brains — especially those of teens — remain vulnerable, and routine collisions can kill.

headline.main: An Ordinary Football Game, Then a Player Dies
headline.print_headline: Seemingly Ordinary Game, Then a Player Dies
headline.seo: Seemingly Ordinary Football Game, Then a Player Dies
